title: Practice Challenge
description:
Create an interactive element:
Click Me!
Write JavaScript that: 1. Finds the box 2. When clicked, toggles a 'highlighted' class 3. Also changes the textContent to show if it's highlighted or normal CSS (already defined): .normal { background: gray; } .highlighted { background: yellow; }
instructions:
Create an interactive element:
Click Me!
Write JavaScript that: 1. Finds the box 2. When clicked, toggles a 'highlighted' class 3. Also changes the textContent to show if it's highlighted or normal CSS (already defined): .normal { background: gray; } .highlighted { background: yellow; }

commonMistakes.correction:
Forgetting camelCase for CSS properties:
   element.style.background-color = 'red';  // SYNTAX ERROR
   element.style.backgroundColor = 'red';  // CORRECT

commonMistakes.consequence: This can lead to errors or unexpected behavior.

   element.style.width = 200;  // WRONG - no effect
   element.style.width = '200px';  // CORRECT
